snippet: Though police departments around the country are scaling back on creating composite drawings of suspects in an era of surveillance video, New York’s three-person Artist Unit stays busy.
abstract: Many police departments have scaled back on composite sketches due to budget constraints and the ubiquity of surveillance video; three-person Artist Unit in New York City's Police Department, however, continues to crank out hundreds of drawings a year, with a witness sketch still part of checklist for all NYPD investigations.
lead_paragraph: Though police departments around the country are scaling back on creating composite drawings of suspects in an era of surveillance video, New York’s three-person Artist Unit stays busy.
